QualityMeasureDocument.title: Diabetic Foot Care and Patient/Caregiver Education Implemented During Short Term Episodes of Care (NQF 0519)
QualityMeasureDocument.text: Percentage of short term home health episodes of care during which diabetic foot care and education were included in the physician-ordered plan of care and implemented for patients with diabetes.

measureAttribute.value: Persons with diabetes are at increased risk for foot ulcers and amputations. Annual, thorough foot examinations, patient education and management of risk factors can prevent or delay adverse outcomes.

The American Diabetes Association (ADA) Clinical Practice Recommendations for 2009 recommend general foot self-care education and foot examination at initial assessment and every follow-up assessment visit. The American Association of Clinical Endocrinologists (AACE) Medical Guidelines for the Management of Diabetes Mellitus (2007) also recommend providing foot examination and foot-care education for all patients with diabetes.
American Association of Clinical Endocrinologists (AACE) Medical Guidelines for the Management of Diabetes Mellitus http://www.aace.com/pub/pdf/guidelines/DMGuidelines2007.pdf

The measure is calculated at the end of a quality episode, which is the period of time from home health admission to transfer or discharge, and only for quality episodes that are 60 days or less (i.e., the quality episode does not include a follow-up assessment that would occur after 60 days). For the purposes of this measure, the assessment refers to the "Outcome and Assessment Information Set (OASIS)".

list.item: AND: "Instance A of Encounter: Home Health (duration <= 60 days)" during "Measurement period"

AND:
OR:
AND: "Instance A of Encounter: Home Health" during "Measurement period"
ends after start of "Diagnosis active: Diabetes"
OR:
AND: "Procedure order: Diabetic Foot Care"
AND: "Intervention order: Diabetic Foot Care Education"
during ("Instance A of Encounter: Home Health" during "Measurement period")

AND:
OR: "Instance A of Encounter: Home Health (status: 'discharged')" during "Measurement period"
OR: "Instance A of Encounter: Hospital Stay (duration >= 24 hours)" starts after end of ("Instance A of Encounter: Home Health" during "Measurement period")
AND: "Initial Patient Population"

AND:
AND NOT:
OR: "Diagnosis active: Bilateral Amputee" starts before start of ("Encounter: Home Health" during "Measurement period")
OR:
AND:
OR: "Diagnosis active: Left Foot Amputee" starts before start of ("Encounter: Home Health" during "Measurement period")
OR: "Diagnosis active: Left Lower Limb Amputee" starts before start of ("Encounter: Home Health" during "Measurement period")
OR:
AND:
OR: "Diagnosis active: Right Foot Amputee" starts before start of ("Encounter: Home Health" during "Measurement period")
OR: "Diagnosis active: Right Lower Limb Amputee" starts before start of ("Encounter: Home Health" during "Measurement period")
OR:
AND: "Diagnosis active: Lower Limb Amputee (laterality: 'right')" starts before start of ("Encounter: Home Health" during "Measurement period")
AND: "Diagnosis active: Lower Limb Amputee (laterality: 'left')" starts before start of ("Encounter: Home Health" during "Measurement period")
OR: "Patient characteristic: Deceased" during ("Encounter: Home Health" during "Measurement period")

AND:
AND: "Procedure performed: Diabetic Foot Care"
AND: "Intervention order: Diabetic Foot Care Education"
AND: "Intervention performed: Diabetic Foot Care Education"
during ("Encounter: Home Health" during "Measurement period")
None

text.content: Calculation is generic to all measures:

list.item: Calculate the final denominator by adding all that meet denominator criteria.
Subtract from the final denominator all that do not meet numerator criteria yet also meet exclusion criteria. Note some measures do not have exclusion criteria.

The performance calculation is based on the "Measure scoring" from header information above:
For "Proportion" measures, the calculation is the number meeting numerator criteria divided by the final denominator.
For "Ratio" and "Continuous Variable" measures, follow the calculation instructions in the Data Aggregation header information above, if present.
For measures with multiple denominators, repeat this process for each denominator and report each result separately.
For measures with multiple patient populations, repeat this process for each patient population and report each result separately.
For measures with multiple numerators, calculate each numerator separately within each population using the paired exclusion.
